description.p: Fangweave is a studded leather armor made from the hides of various lycan predators, such as wolves, bears, and rats The armor is adorned with razor-sharp fangs and claws, which have been carefully sewn into the leather to create a menacing appearance. When worn, the armor seems to take on a life of its own, as if the spirits of the creatures from which it was made have been imbued into the armor. The armor is lightweight and flexible, allowing for maximum mobility in combat, and is designed specifically for Blood Hunters and members of the Order of the Lycan. The fangs and claws of the armor also grant the user additional protection against beasts magical pyhsical attacks, and provide the wearer with enhanced senses and tracking abilities. The Fangweave is a symbol of the wearer's mastery of the hunt, and a warning to any who would dare to cross their path.
Effect: When a Blood Hunter / Order of the Lycan class member wears the Fangweave, they gain the following benefits:

ul.li: The armor is a +1 magic armor.
The user gains a +2 bonus to their Survival and Perception skills.
The user can cast the pass without trace spell once per day without expending a spell slot.

description.p: Beast Warding: The user gains resistance to all magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by beasts. In addition, the user has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, or paralyzed by beasts.

The Grim Resolve: Once per long rest, when the wearer would be reduced to 0 hit points, they can use their reaction to instead drop to 1 hit point and enter a state of deathly determination. While in this state, if the Crimson Rite actives, the wearer gains their melee attacks deal one additional Hemocraft Die damage equal to your active Rite's damage type (Hemocraft Die increases with the wearer's Blood Hunter Level), and gain temporary hit points equal to their Blood Hunter level + their Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). This state of deathly determination lasts for 1 minute or until the wearer is knocked unconscious or killed. After the state ends, the wearer suffers one level of exhaustion. The Grim Resolve ability reflects the Blood Hunter's unwavering determination and willingness to defy death itself in order to achieve their goals.

set.name: attunement
set.addition: by a Order of the Lycan

description.p: This finely crafted armor resonates with the essence of nature itself, designed specifically to empower those who are attuned to the wilds. It embodies the harmony between the natural world and the druid who wears it, granting protection without compromising the connection to the primal forces.
Effect: When a druid class member wears the Fangweave, they gain the following benefits:

ul.li: The armor is a +1 magic armor.
The user gains a +1 bonus to their Survival and Nature skills.
The user gains bonus +4 AC in Wild Shape form, regardless from the animal type.

description.p: The Aegis of the Eldritch Guardian is a shield that is forged from the ironwood of Escar Forest, imbued with the essence of ancient protective magic. The shield's surface is etched with eldritch runes that glow faintly, providing an aura of otherworldly protection.
Effect: When a paladin dons this shield, they gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Armor Class (AC) Bonus. +1 to AC while wielding this shield.

Eldritch Protection. As a reaction, when you are hit by an attack from an eldritch horror or any creature with the Aberration type, you can activate the shield's magic to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once) per long rest.

Guardian's Resolve. Once per long rest, as an action, you can call upon the shield's guardian spirit. For the next minute, you gain resistance to psychic damage, and any creature that hits you with a melee attack takes psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
Spell Effect. You can cast the shield of faith spell once per day without using a spell slot. When cast this way, the spell has a duration of 1 hour instead of the usual 10 minutes.

Light of Protection. As a bonus action, you can cause the shield to emit bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. This light lasts for 1 hour or until you dismiss it as a bonus action. While the shield is emitting light, you and allies within the bright light have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
